Short description: Trust Stamp is an AI powered, privacy- first identity company. Trust Stamp establishes trust in digital spaces by answering the questions "Who are you?" and "Can I trust you?"
Long description:
Trust Stamp recognizes the challenges increased digitization brings and has responded with solutions that provide users with a secure, private, and accessible identity. Trust Stamp establishes trust in a connected world, delivering trusted identity systems at the heart of how organizations and individuals transact. Trust Stamp enables enterprises to trust the identities they encounter and enables customers to trust that their identity is private and secure. Allowing good customers to transact more freely and keeping fraudsters out.

Trust Stamp answers the ultimate question of ‘Who am I dealing with?’. Is the person accessing the systems at that point in time, a real person and the right person? Trust Stamp’s patented technology enables businesses and public sector services to create trust and to protect themselves and their users, while empowering individuals to retain ownership of their data and prevent fraudulent activity using their identity. 

Trust Stamp’s biometric hashing technology enables enterprises to implement biometric convenience and security for their customers without the risk. Through our unique and patented technology, we convert biometric information into a cryptographic code. This eliminates the need to store any biometric information, making your biometric implementation more secure and privacy law-compliant.
Technical description:
The Irreversibly Transformed Identity Token (IT2)
Trust Stamp has developed a unique and patent-protected Irreversibly Transformed Identity Token (IT2) to help protect biometric templates and personal data in general. The IT2 enhances security and privacy by converting biometric data into meaningless characters, which are of no use if they leak accidentally or are stolen by would-be identity thieves. A given IT2 cannot be reversed to recover the original data.



The main purpose of an IT2 is to enable the safe, private matching of a piece of Personal Data to a previously registered record. Any given IT2 taken out of context will generally be unlinkable to an individual. Thus, IT2 has the potential to transform the protection of biometric data against identity theft.



The IT2 is the product of unique award-winning research & development by Trust Stamp’s security scientists. IT2 tokens are irreversible. With the incorporation of a randomising seed which can be varied in the generation of each new token, IT2s are also revocable. IT2 tokenisation obviates the retention of biometric reference templates, improving privacy, reducing exposure to identity theft, and enhancing regulatory compliance.

Backbase is a private fintech company, founded in 2003 in Amsterdam (Global HQ), with regional offices in Atlanta (Americas HQ), Boise, Cardiff, Dubai, Hyderabad, Kraków, London, Mexico City, Milano, New York, Singapore (Asia HQ), Sydney, and Toronto.
Technical description:
The Backbase Engagement Banking Platform provides a full suite of integrated solutions:

Digital Banking: Self-service apps for daily banking, empowering customers to do all their banking online
Digital Onboarding: Our digital customer onboarding (account opening) that enables fast, cost-effective, and secure customer acquisition
Digital Lending: Our lending solution helps improves your ability to quickly grow your loan book
Digital Assist: Our member support platform that empowers front-office employees (branch, call center, advisors, relationship managers) to quickly and efficiently assist members
Digital Engage: Our solution that empowers marketing teams to craft data-driven, targeted campaigns that reach members at the right moment
Digital Investing: Our investing solution enables digital investment propositions, including robo-advisors
Grand Central (iPaaS): Our suite of cloud services enabling development, execution and governance of integration flows connecting any combination of on premises and cloud-based processes, services, applications and data within individual or across multiple organizations
Managed Services: Our solutions to assist in maintaining the platform and accelerating feature development.
The Backbase platform has a loosely coupled n-tiered application that caters to the separation of concerns. Our front-end views use a journey-based architecture made up of multiple views, which are small, autonomous apps used to compose digital banking experiences. Journeys communicate using RESTful APIs using a microservices architecture. In terms of separation of responsibilities, we distinguish between the following layers:

Engagement layer: This layer contains microservices related to the experience orchestration (e.g. portal, content, Experience Manager, provisioning, publishing, etc.)
Digital Banking Services layer: This layer contains the digital banking microservices that provide the data and business logic that is consumed by the front-end views.
Digital Onboarding layer: This layer provides the microservices that support the onboarding, lending, and case management journeys
Identity & Access layer: This layer provides the identity journeys, which supports to strong customer authentication ('SCA') and identity management. This includes fine-grained entitlements that provide access control, limits and approval workflows for digital banking.

Long description: Baselayer leverages proprietary machine learning to search all US government records, the web, and private databases to automate tasks for Compliance, Risk, or Fraud about any business in the United States. Our platform also offers unique credit stacking capabilities and an advanced repeat fraud prevention system.    Baselayer maintains a database of over 100 million business records, with all 33 million active businesses in the US kept up to date on a daily level. Baselayer's network is built by companies with over 30 million accounts, rating and verifying real-time applications.
Technical description: Baselayer is a technology-driven company that specializes in automating business risk assessment and mitigating B2B (business-to-business) fraud within the financial sector. The company's core offering revolves around leveraging advanced algorithms, machine learning, and big data analytics to provide comprehensive risk assessments and fraud detection solutions for financial transactions between businesses.

Name: Digsfact Inc
Short description: DigsFact Uses AI to prevent financial crime like money laundering and fraud, BEFORE they occur, by stopping such transactions from being completed and handing them over to humans (investigation unit of the financial institution) for further investigation.
Long description: Our product is called "The PreCogs", which uses AI to prevent financial crime like money laundering and fraud, BEFORE they occur, by stopping such transactions from being completed and handing them over to humans for further investigation.    DigsFact won 2nd place in a Global Innovation Challenge hosted by SWIFT! Below is a short video of our conversation with SWIFT's head of Financial Crime, where they asked us to showcase our solution to the entire SWIFT community:    https://youtu.be/u7NbZIU9TSI
Technical description: Our product is called "The PreCogs", which uses AI to prevent financial crime like money laundering and fraud:     This is driven by our 2 AI models, which we call our PreCogs, that can detect a potential financial crime like money laundering or fraud in any transaction, any currency, anywhere, with an extremely high accuracy of 99.7% and a near perfect F1-Score.    Once a transaction is red-flagged by our PreCogs for potential financial crime, the transaction is paused and the details of the transaction along with the explanation for flagging the transaction is handed over to the designated investigating team of the financial institution.    Our AI models self-evolve and predict new crime patterns by using generative adversarial network and train themselves to detect such patterns. This helps our model always stay updated on even the newest crime patterns that no one has experienced yet and stop them from occurring.

Name: Dwolla
Short description: Powering innovations with sophisticated account-to-account payment solutions.
Long description: Dwolla is a fintech company helping innovative organizations power sophisticated account-to-account payment solutions.  Dwolla’s robust platform, low-code API, and partnership ecosystem simplify the complex process of integrating with the various payment networks to create a single end-to-end solution. Integrating Dwolla’s modern payment technology gives a business the ability to program payments in real-time, on the same day or to a debit card 24/7.  With minimal development, start-ups to Fortune 500 companies can gain efficiency, flexibility and improved cash flow by working with Dwolla.  Technology Description  Dwolla provides an API that will give you the ability to connect your software to banking infrastructure to move money, store funds, validate customer identities, and verify bank accounts. Attributes: ACH Infrastructure: Dwolla has built a robust and reliable Automated Clearing House (ACH) infrastructure that enables secure and efficient fund transfers between financial institutions. This infrastructure forms the backbone of Dwolla's payment processing capabilities.  Developer-Friendly APIs: Dwolla provides developer-friendly APIs and SDKs (Software Development Kits) that simplify the integration of its payment capabilities into various applications and platforms. These APIs offer flexibility and customization options, allowing businesses to tailor payment experiences to their specific needs.  Real-Time Payments: Dwolla supports real-time payments, enabling the near-instantaneous transfer of funds between bank accounts. This feature enhances transaction speed and responsiveness, particularly for time-sensitive scenarios such as payroll processing or immediate disbursements.  White-Label Solutions: Dwolla offers white-label solutions that empower businesses to build and brand their own payment experiences. This allows companies to maintain their brand identity and provide a seamless payment experience to their customers.  Enhanced Security Measures: Dwolla places a strong emphasis on security. It incorporates various security protocols and measures to protect sensitive financial data and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations, such as encryption, tokenization, and multi-factor authentication.  Compliance and Regulatory Expertise: Dwolla has deep knowledge and expertise in compliance and regulatory requirements within the payment industry. It adheres to rigorous standards, including Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) regulations, to ensure the integrity and legality of transactions.  Scalability and Reliability: Dwolla's infrastructure is designed to handle high volumes of transactions while maintaining stability and reliability. It can seamlessly scale to accommodate growing business needs and peak transaction periods without compromising performance.  Analytics and Reporting: Dwolla provides comprehensive analytics and reporting tools that offer insights into transaction data, volume trends, and other key metrics. These tools enable businesses to gain valuable business intelligence and make data-driven decisions.

Name: Elastic
Short description: Elastic provides a distributed, real-time search and analytics engine for various types of data, enabling users to explore large datasets and derive insights.
Long description: Elastic is a search company that builds self-managed and SaaS offerings that make data usable in real-time and at scale for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. With solutions like the Elastic Stack, Elastic Cloud, and Elastic Security, the company aims to simplify the way organizations utilize their data.  Tech Description:  Elastic's core technology is the Elasticsearch distributed search and analytics engine, built on Apache Lucene. It provides real-time search, full-text search, structured search, and analytics capabilities for various types of data. The Elastic Stack also includes Kibana for data visualization, Logstash for data ingestion and processing, and Beats for lightweight data shippers.  Attributes:   Distributed Architecture: Elastic's technology is designed to be distributed, allowing it to scale horizontally and handle large volumes of data across multiple nodes.  Real-time Search and Analytics: Elastic enables real-time search and analytics on data as it is ingested, providing near-instant insights and visibility into data streams.  Full-Text and Structured Search: Elastic supports full-text search, allowing users to search across unstructured data like logs, documents, and texts, as well as structured data like databases and metrics.  Data Ingestion and Processing: With Logstash and Beats, Elastic offers robust data ingestion and processing capabilities, enabling users to collect, parse, and enrich data from various sources.  Data Visualization: Kibana, the data visualization component of the Elastic Stack, provides users with powerful tools to create visualizations, dashboards, and reports based on their data.
